groups.content: Mott transition and superconductivity in the strongly correlated organic
superconductor k-(BEDT-TTF)2CuN(CN)2Br
T. Sasaki,* N. Yoneyama, and N. Kobayashi
Institute for Materials Research, Tohoku University,
Katahira 2-1-1, Aoba-ku, Sendai 980-8577, Japan
(Dated: August 9, 2021)
The magnetic field effect on the phase diagram of the organic Mott system K-(BEDT-
TTF)2Cu[N(CN)2|Br in which the bandwidth was tuned by the substitution of deuterated molecules
was studied by means of the resistivity measurements performed in magnetic fields. The lower criti-
cal point of the first-order Mott transition, which ended on the upper critical field Hc2-temperature
plane of the superconductivity, was determined experimentally in addition to the previously ob-
served upper critical end point. The lower critical end point moved to a lower temperature with
the suppression of Tc in magnetic fields and the Mott transition recognized SO far as the S-shaped
curve reached T = 0 when H > H2 in the end.
PACS numbers: 74.70.Kn, 71.30.+h, 74.25.Dw
